nl.naturalis.nda.elasticsearch.load

Class AbstractTransformer<INPUT,OUTPUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.nda.elasticsearch.load.AbstractTransformer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    INPUT - The type of object serving as input to the transformer
    OUTPUT - The type of object that is output from the transformer
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transformer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCSVTransformer, AbstractXMLTransformer

    public abstract class AbstractTransformer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
extends Object
implements Transformer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
    Abstract base class for all transformers. Provides functionality for uniform error reporting.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public final List<OUTPUT> transform(INPUT input)
        This class provides a final implementation of the method defined by the Transformer interface while providing a template for subclassess to do the heavy-lifting through three template methods:
        1. skipRecord() to determine if the record should be skipped
        2. getObjectID() to extract the object ID from the currently processed record (needed for logging purposes)
        3. doTransform() to validate the input and produce the output
        Specified by:
        transform in interface Transformer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
        Returns:

      • skipRecord

        protected boolean skipRecord()
        Whether or not to skip the current record. By default all records are processed, but subclasses can override this method to discard records before they are even handed over to the doTransform() method. They can use the protected input field to determine if the record should be skipped.
        Returns:

      • getObjectID

        protected abstract String getObjectID()
        Get the value of the field that is to be regarded as the ID of the object. Subclasses must implement this, because this abstract base class needs it for reporting purposes. Subclasses can use the protected input field to retrieve the ID in an implementation-dependent way.
        Returns:

      • doTransform

        protected abstract List<OUTPUT> doTransform()
        Does the heavy-lifting of the transformation phase. Left to subclasses to implement.
        Returns:

      • getStatistics

        public ETLStatistics getStatistics()
        Get the statistics object updated by this transformer.
        Returns:
        The statistics object updated by this transformer

      • isSuppressErrors

        public boolean isSuppressErrors()
        Whether or not error suppression is on.
        Returns:

      • setSuppressErrors

        public void setSuppressErrors(boolean suppressErrors)
        Whether or not to suppress errors. With error suppression, INFO messages are let through while most ERROR and all WARN messages are suppressed. This may make the log file more readable if you expect huge amounts of well-known, anticipated errors. There is some intelligence in which error messages are suppressed. If the import program generates the error (meaning it sort of already anticipated the error condition), the error message is suppressed. However if the error is caught in a catch-all block, the error is always logged, even with error suppression enabled.
        Parameters:
        suppressErrors -
        See Also:
        handleError(Throwable)

      • handleError

        protected void handleError(Throwable t)
        Handles a validation error. Increases the objectsRejected counter by one and logs a standardized error message. The error message is logged even if error suppression is enabled, because the assumption is that this method is called only for unexpected errors, mostly likely caught in a catch-all block, that you do not want to miss. If DEBUG is enabled the specified throwable's stack trace is logged as well.
        Parameters:
        t - An (unanticipated) exception thrown while transformer the XML input
        See Also:
        setSuppressErrors(boolean)

      • messagePrefix

        protected String messagePrefix()
        A standard prefix for all messages logged using one of the specialized log methods in this class. The idea is that any message is by default prefixed with the ID of the object for which the message was generated. By default the message prefix is a right-padded column containing the object ID of the validated object. Therefore, one of the first things subclasses must do in their implementation of transform() is set the objectID field. Subclasses may override messagePrefix() if appropriate.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        error(String, Object...), warn(String, Object...), info(String, Object...), debug(String, Object...)
